thread.title: Colorado gas prices fall to average of $2.38 per gallon
thread.title_full: Colorado gas prices fall to average of $2.38 per gallon - The Denver Post

author: Alicia Wallace
title: Colorado gas prices fall to average of $2.38 per gallon
text:
Gas prices in Colorado dropped another 8 cents in the past week, bringing the statewide average to $2.38 per gallon, according to GasBuddy.com data released Monday.
Colorado's continued post-Labor Day slide in prices outpaced the decline of the national average, which dropped 0.5 cents per gallon to $2.29 per gallon.
"While the rate of decline has slowed we still expect the overall decline to continue this week with a nominal decrease in retail gasoline in most parts of the country," Gregg Laskoski, a senior petroleum analyst for GasBuddy, said in a statement.
Colorado has the 18th most expensive gas in the nation.
Average prices across Colorado counties ranged from $2.12 per gallon in Huerfano County to $3.60 per gallon in Pitkin County.
Denver prices fell 6.2 cents per gallon to $2.35 per gallon.
Alicia Wallace: 303-954-1939, awallace@denverpost.com or @aliciawallace
